reviews.review_msg: Dr. Gries is a great professor, he speaks with passion and is clearly very accomplished in his field. This course totally changed my perspective on insects and allowed me to see the importance of this topic. My only complaint would be how much work is expected of us, since the course is only 3 credits.

Gerhard Greis is by far one of the most approachable professors I have come across at SFU. He is also extremely kind and considerate of his students. My only criticism is how much we were expected to do for this 3 credit course. 2 lab exams, 2 lecture exams, a poster project, and an extremely time-consuming insect collection. The class avg was a B-

This course was like taking 2 classes. The lab had a difficult insect collection with a class average of around 50% for the collection. The poster presentation was easy. The lecture midterm (average 60%) and final were purely based on memorization of lecture notes. Lab lecture and final were purely memorization. 2 midterms and 2 finals for 1 class

Amazing prof. Caring, clear, and exams are straight from the notes. Extremely well respected in his field but always speaks clearly and explains the big/new words. No assignments, just MT and Final for the lecture portion. Highly recommend this course even for ppl who are more into human anatomy - so much is similar and a great way to learn.

Overall the lab component was more work than the lecture stuff. You have to attend lectures to get the notes because he doesn't use canvas. However, he's a nice guy and I would take another course with him!

Dr. Gries is a great prof,  his lectures are interesting and entertaining and  exams were very fair.    The only thing is that he doesn't give them back so you don't really know how you're doing in the class until you get the letter grade.  The lab is very instensive,   You have to do 2 lab exams, a big bug collection and a presentation.
A lot of work for this course, especially towards the last half of the semester.

Gerhard was my favourite prof in the 4 years I've been at SFU. His lecture notes are super clear but you have to go to class because they aren't posted online. He actually shows up to labs and helps out, and answers questions extremely thoughtfully and kindly. Would take this class again.

This is honestly the most fun and easiest to pass biology course. Insect Biology felt more like a 200 level course bc there was a bit of tedious work involved (poster, insect collection, lab). Thus, this course is not hard but is quite time consuming. Make sure to attend lectures and study your notes. All his exams are based off lecture material.
Great professor as he even gets to know your name which I liked. Classes were kinda interesting so I would recommend going. Quite a bit of work involved overall but a good class.

One of the most fun, interesting and time-consuming courses of my degree. The insect collection was the most fun assignment I've done, but also so time-consuming. Exams were pretty fair except for there were a few trick Qs. The midterm didn't ask for examples, but almost all the short answer Qs on the final were examples of which insects did what.

Exams are based off lectures, which Gries makes easy to follow and understand. He is an excellent professor. The book is listed as required but I never used it for this class. Lab exams were based on the handouts provided to students. Yes - you will be required to collect 30 insects for this class (10%). Make sure to start collecting insects early!

The only problem for this course is having so many things to do (it worths only 3 credits!!!!). poster presentation, insect collection, insect labling  are time consuming. Take it if you only  have onetwo courses max. prof is really nice and caring  though.

Professor Gries has been one of my favorite professors that I've encountered so far. His interest in the course is obviously very high, he's extremely knowledgeable, and best is he is very thorough when he explains material and concepts. Take this course with him, he will change your view on insects!

One of the most humble profs there is. Notes are quite clear; shows tons of videos in class; slightly hard marker but quite fair overall; has two AWESOME ta's; highly recommended. Oh and...he totally looks like Santa Claus.

Dr. Gries is a hard marker, but that is the only negative thing you'll hear of him. He is extremely helpful, funny, and shows a lot of videos in his classes. The lab portion is easy and can easily offset the hard lecture marking. For the insect collection I recommend you read the lab web page and follow it strictly to get some of the harder orders.

VERY nice guy, very funny, loves the material.  Unfortunately, he curriculum was way off.  Basically, rather than teaching about ecology, he teaches a bunch of examples, then tests you on those examples.  The principles underlying the examples remain unaddressed.  An easy GPA booster, but don't expect to actually learn much more than trivia.
Really hard marker; totally approachable and takes the time to spend with students to make sure they understand his concepts; his videos during class rock.

He is the best prof in the world. There is no one better than him. He is so passionate about what he does and he makes his class so interesting that you do not want the class to end. Love him he is awesome!

I had no interest in ecology, and thought it would be the most boring class. But Dr Gries is a great prof, the class was vvv interesting. only thing i had to study for exam were his notes. he is very nice and extremely helpful. his exams were straight out of notes. i really look forward to take another class with him. i highly recommend him.
He is awesome. He is so passionate about teaching and biology that it's contagious. His videos were spectacular and he is just the best prof ever at SFU. Go to lectures and you'll be fine.

Mr. Gries' lectures were always so interesting! He is so passionate about his field which makes class a pleasure to attend. The tests were all straight out of the notes! Go to lecture, get a good grade!
enjoyed every day. Movies are the key to his wonderfulness!
HE WAS THE BEST! GO TO LECTURE!!! I GOT AN A+ WHOPEEEEEE...JUST GO TO LECTURE!!!

very enthusiastic prof. super approachable. MAKE SURE U GO TO CLASS! his notes are clear and concise, and his exams are uber easy. Never tries to trick u. The only hard part is that it IS an anatomy course, u are required to memorize an insane amount of material in order to do well. The lab is CRAP, WAY too much work, although the TA's are great.

Gerhard's the best professor I've ever had since I've been to SFU.  He cares so much about his work, and about his teaching that I almost feel bad whenever I walk in late for his 8:30am classes!  (He always thanks us for coming and waking up, heh heh.)  His tests are really hard, but it's all straight out of all of his lecture notes!
EXCELLENT PROF!! He is fun & very nice!! Great Class/Be very specific on answers to do well on exams/straight forward exams

I love this guy! He actually cares about the students and was very approachable, he has no aggressive ego. A great teacher, he is enthusiastic about the subject matter and very clear and straight-forward. For sure the best biology prof i've had!
What can I say....my favorite Biology professor, nay, my favorite professor.  He is great.  He remembers names.  He is bald with a cool beard.  He is very smart.  He loves bugs.
Best prof ever. Take his class and you wouldn't regreat it at all. The best part of his class is that he will try and remember you by your name and he does it really well. Kudos to Dr. Gries.

Seriously, one of the if not the best prof i've had at sfu. He clearly cares about his students and actually makes coming to class worthwhile. For those of you ever considering taking any of his classes especially 204 TAKE IT!!!!!

204 and 317 both had very fair exams. Just know the notes, and the tests are easy. He's a great prof- enthusiastic and entertaining. Shows many videos in class and does little demonstrations, which helps those who learn better visually.
Best prof I've had in my 5 years in SFU. But he likes to put 1 trick question in his exams, so watch out for that.
His notes are really clear and the tests are straight out of the notes, but the marking scheme on assignments is extremely vague.
funny guy. good stories. lots of movies. gives beer to those who volunteer and tests are straight from the notes. MEMORIZE THE NOTES
No Comments
One of the nicest profs.  He's very helpful and entertaining.
Awesome professor, awesome notes!!!  Very helpful and funny.  Go to class, trust me you'll enjoy it!
Awesome prof!
Great prof, tough tests
A fantastic lecturer, but beware his exams... they are crazy hard!!!
Gerhard rocks the house. TOTALLY wants you to learn and makes it easy to do so.
Funny, enthusiastic, knowlegeable.
one of the best professors I've ever had...he truly wants you to  understand
